title: Creator Compliance Final Exam
description: Comprehensive exam covering all legal, compliance, and operational requirements for content creators. Passing is required for monetization.

questions.question: What is your employment status as a content creator on Fanz?
questions.explanation: Content creators are independent contractors, not employees. This means you're responsible for your own taxes, compliance, and business operations.

questions.question: What tax form will Fanz issue if you earn $600 or more in a year?
questions.explanation: Fanz issues 1099-NEC (Non-Employee Compensation) for creators earning $600 or more.

questions.question: What additional tax do self-employed individuals pay?
questions.explanation: Self-employed individuals pay 15.3% self-employment tax for Social Security and Medicare, in addition to income tax.

questions.question: What federal law requires age verification records for adult content?
questions.explanation: 18 U.S.C. ยง 2257 specifically requires producers of sexually explicit content to verify and maintain records proving all performers are 18 or older.

questions.question: How long must 2257 records be retained?
questions.explanation: 2257 requires records to be maintained for 7 years from the date of last publication or performer's last activity.

questions.question: Who is the PRIMARY producer of content?
options: The person who films/creates the content
questions.explanation: The primary producer is the person who directly films or creates the sexually explicit content.

questions.question: What records must be kept for each performer?
options: Legal name, date of birth, ID copy, all stage names, content URLs
questions.explanation: Complete 2257 records require: legal name, date of birth, government ID copy, all stage names/aliases, and URLs where content appears.

questions.question: How quickly must records be produced for FBI inspection?
questions.explanation: Records must be retrievable and producible within 20 minutes of an FBI inspection request.

questions.question: What is the maximum penalty for 2257 violations?
questions.explanation: Second and subsequent 2257 violations can result in up to 10 years imprisonment.

questions.question: When must you verify a collaborator's ID?
questions.explanation: ID verification must happen BEFORE any filming occurs. Never during, never after - always before.

questions.question: What types of ID are acceptable for 2257 verification?
questions.explanation: Only valid government-issued photo IDs are acceptable: passport, driver's license, state/national ID, or military ID.

questions.question: What information must be in your Custodian of Records statement?
questions.explanation: Your 2257 statement must include the name and physical address of the Custodian of Records.

questions.question: How many prohibited content categories are there?
questions.explanation: There are 9 prohibited categories: CSAM, appearing to depict minors, incest, bestiality, non-consent, necrophilia, bodily waste, extreme violence, and trafficking.

questions.question: What is the risk score threshold for automatic content blocking?
questions.explanation: Content with risk score 80-100 is automatically blocked.

questions.question: What happens when CSAM is detected?
options: Immediate permanent ban + law enforcement notification
questions.explanation: CSAM detection triggers immediate permanent ban, mandatory NCMEC report, FBI notification, and evidence preservation.

questions.question: Is 'step-family' content prohibited?
options: Yes, all family-related sexual content is prohibited
questions.explanation: All family-related content including step-family is prohibited by payment processors.

questions.question: Why is CNC (consensual non-consent) prohibited?
options: Payment processors can't distinguish real from fake non-consent
It's only prohibited for new creators
questions.explanation: Payment processors ban all non-consent depictions because they cannot distinguish genuine from roleplay.

questions.question: What term should you use instead of 'teen'?
questions.explanation: 'Amateur' is a safe alternative that doesn't emphasize youth in sexual context.

questions.question: How many trafficking indicators are monitored?
questions.explanation: The platform monitors for 13 trafficking indicators including third-party control, coercion language, and distress signals.

questions.question: Which BDSM content is allowed?
questions.explanation: Consensual BDSM with safety measures is allowed. Blood, strangulation, and weapons are prohibited.

questions.question: Why is 'barely legal' marketing prohibited?
questions.explanation: 'Barely legal' sexualizes youth and is banned by payment processors as adjacent to CSAM interest.

questions.question: What is a red flag during collaborator verification?
options: Third party speaking for the performer
questions.explanation: Third-party control of communication is a major trafficking red flag.

questions.question: Is age play allowed?
options: No, pretending to be underage is prohibited
questions.explanation: Age play - pretending to be underage in sexual content - is prohibited regardless of actual ages.

questions.question: What should you do if you suspect trafficking?
options: Do NOT proceed, report to platform and authorities
questions.explanation: If you suspect trafficking, do NOT proceed. Report immediately and consider contacting authorities.

questions.question: What compliance checks run before external platform uploads?
options: CSAM detection, payment processor compliance, trafficking assessment, platform rules
questions.explanation: MediaHub runs comprehensive checks including CSAM detection, payment processor compliance, trafficking assessment, and platform-specific rules.

questions.question: Which platform has the strictest content policies?
questions.explanation: OnlyFans has some of the strictest policies after their 2021 payment processor issues.

questions.question: Is sexually explicit content allowed on Patreon?
questions.explanation: Patreon does NOT allow sexually explicit content. Nudity may be allowed in artistic contexts only.

questions.question: What setting should you avoid?
questions.explanation: School and classroom settings suggest underage participants and are prohibited.

questions.question: How long does a first strike remain on record?
questions.explanation: First strikes remain for 12 months and clear after 12 months of clean compliance.

questions.question: What is the suspension length for second-strike moderate violation?
questions.explanation: Moderate second-strike violations result in 14-day suspension.

questions.question: Which violation type has NO appeal option?
questions.explanation: CSAM, trafficking, and fraud violations have no appeal. These decisions are final.

questions.question: How long to appeal a first warning?
questions.explanation: First warnings can be appealed within 7 days.

questions.question: Which business structure provides liability protection?
questions.explanation: An LLC provides personal liability protection while remaining tax-flexible.

questions.question: When are quarterly tax payments due?
questions.explanation: Quarterly payments are due April 15, June 15, September 15, and January 15.

questions.question: What should a model release include?
options: Performer info, production info, rights, compensation, consent declarations, signatures
questions.explanation: A comprehensive model release includes all performer information, production details, rights granted, compensation, consent declarations, and signatures.

questions.question: If you purchase content, what are your obligations?
questions.explanation: As a secondary producer, you must obtain and maintain copies of 2257 records from the primary producer.

questions.question: What factor decreases risk score?
questions.explanation: Complete 2257 documentation, certification, and clean history decrease risk scores.

questions.question: What is the risk score impact of family terms?
questions.explanation: Family-related terms result in +80 risk points, triggering automatic blocking.

questions.question: After third violation, what happens?
questions.explanation: Third strike results in permanent ban with content removal and potential earnings forfeiture.

questions.question: What documentation is required for collaborators?
options: ID copy, model release, age declaration, legal name, DOB, stage names
questions.explanation: Complete documentation includes ID copy, model release, age declaration, legal name, DOB, and stage names.

questions.question: If CSAM_DETECTED error occurs, what happens?
options: Immediate account flag, NCMEC report, cannot proceed
questions.explanation: CSAM detection triggers immediate flagging, blocking, and mandatory NCMEC reporting. No retry possible.

questions.question: What platform might allow content OnlyFans blocks?
questions.explanation: ManyVids has historically been more permissive, though you should always verify current policies.

questions.question: What is required for reinstatement after suspension?
options: Complete training, pass quiz, acknowledge terms
questions.explanation: Reinstatement requires completing modules, passing with 80%+, and acknowledging policies.

questions.question: How long is enhanced monitoring after reinstatement?
questions.explanation: Enhanced content screening applies for 90 days after reinstatement.

questions.question: What law makes platforms liable for facilitating trafficking?
questions.explanation: FOSTA-SESTA (2018) makes platforms potentially liable for facilitating sex trafficking.

questions.question: How much notice does FBI typically give for inspection?
questions.explanation: FBI typically gives 48 hours notice, though they can inspect without notice in some cases.

questions.question: What content category skips strike system entirely?
questions.explanation: CSAM and trafficking result in immediate permanent ban with no prior strikes.

questions.question: A collaborator mentions 'having to do this' to pay someone. What should you do?
questions.explanation: Coercion language suggesting debt or obligation is a serious trafficking indicator. Do not proceed.

questions.question: What should you do if content fails PAYMENT_PROCESSOR_VIOLATION?
questions.explanation: Read the error, identify the specific issue, make targeted changes, and re-screen.

questions.question: What happens if you try creating account after permanent ban?
questions.explanation: Banned IDs are flagged. Attempting new account is detected and results in immediate re-ban.

uponPassing: Access to full Creator Portal features
uponFailing: Detailed feedback on missed topics by category
Recommended to review specific modules before retaking
